main event: A UFO sighting was reported at Stewart AFB, New York on 19 August 1958. The object was observed for about two minutes by military personnel and was concluded to be a balloon, possibly similar to a weather balloon.
interesting points: The sighting was observed by military personnel at Stewart AFB, adding credibility to the report.
An astronomer analyzed the object and suggested it was probably a balloon, similar to a weather balloon.
The object was described as red and slightly larger than a star, and it was observed to have a straight course from north to south.
The report mentions that there were no ground visuals of the object and no photographs were included in the report.
At the time of the sighting, there was also a bright red glow reported in Beacon, New York, possibly related to the observed object.
result: prosaic explanation: the object was concluded to be a balloon, possibly similar to a weather balloon
sighted object: unidentified object described as red and slightly larger than a star
